newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australis returns with stronger price.
newsitem.headline: Australis returns with stronger price.

text.p: Shares in Australis Media Ltd rose 3.5 cents to 22 cents on its relisting on the Australian Stock Exchange on Tuesday, the first time it has traded since Friday's annoucement that it would merge with pay television rival Foxtel.
By 12.20 p.m. (0220 GMT), Australis shares were 3.5 cents, or about 19 percent higher, at 22 cents with over 900,000 shares traded.
Foxtel is equally owned by The News Corp Ltd and state-owned telecommunications group Telstra Corp.
Under the merger terms, News Corp and Telstra would take a 66.5 percent stake in Australis, with existing Australis shareholders owning the remainder.
"It coming off such a low base. It does not really reflect much and it does not help those that paid A$1.20 or a A$1.50 to get into Australis," one Sydney based broker said.
The broker said the market was still trying to work out the value of the merger.
Australis shares hit a record of A$1.65 in March 1994, but its shares have remained under 40 cents for most of the past year.
